words.def: grow vigorously
ornament consisting of a circular rounded protuberance (as on a vault or shield or belt)
a teeming multitude
County/City (Proper noun)
A green colour, now only in heraldry; represented in engraving by diagonal parallel lines 45 degrees counter-clockwise.
a newly hired employee
a person who is entitled by law or by the terms of a will to inherit the estate of another
tear or be torn violently
an established ceremony prescribed by a religion
a relative position or degree of value in a graded group
hoop that covers a wheel
a doctor who practices veterinary medicine
With a comparative or more and a verb phrase, establishes a parallel with one or more other such comparatives.
rate of revolution of a motor
made warm or hot (`het' is a dialectal variant of `heated')
(baseball) a successful stroke in an athletic contest (especially in baseball)
move fast

A letter capital Ð, small ð introduced into Old English to represent its dental fricative, then not distinguished from the letter thorn, no longer used in English but still in modern use in Icelandic, Faroese, and phonetics to represent the voiced dental fricative "th" sound as in the English word then.
compete for something
place (flax, hemp, or jute) in liquid so as to promote loosening of the fibers from the woody tissue
An old Portuguese money of account .
a strong emotion
neckwear consisting of a long narrow piece of material worn (mostly by men) under a collar and tied in knot at the front
Of bad quality.
an expression of greeting
a very light colorless element that is one of the six inert gasses
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
a light strong grey lustrous corrosion-resistant metallic element used in strong lightweight alloys (as for airplane parts)
a rare heavy polyvalent metallic element that resembles manganese chemically and is used in some alloys
the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
